question.text: Enthalpies of formation of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>CCl</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>(</mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>,</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>(</mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>)</mo></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>HCl</mi></math> are <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>-</mo><mn>105</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>242</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>394</mn></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>-</mo><mn>92</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kJ</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> respectively. The magnitude of enthalpy of the reaction given below is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>kJmol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>. (nearest integer) <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>CCl</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>(</mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>(</mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>HCl</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>)</mo></math>

solution.text:
Using Hess's law of constant heat summation:
Enthalpy of reaction = Enthalpy of formation of products - Enthalpy of formation of reactants
∴ΔHf°=ΔHf°CO2, g+4ΔHf°(HCl)-ΔHf°CCl4-2ΔHf°H2O,r

=[-394]+4[-92]+105-2×[242]

=-394-368+105+484

=-173 kJ/mole
